column13: Thanks to the CodeRefinery workshop I now have a more structured approach to programming. The workshop also helped me get started using it in my daily work process. Even though I currently don't use all tools that the workshop covered I think I now, after attending the workshop, have an easier time getting starting with for instance automated testing.     Overall a very nice workshop that I have recommended colleges to attend!
column14: I think it would be very interesting to have a workshop that focused more on one particular language, for instance how to write fast code in python. It would also be of interest to have a more lengthy discussion on how to structure and organize the code base.  Another thing that I found to be challenging can be to simply set up a useful "system" to name various files and folders, such that it is possible to keep track of the results for one project over time.

column14: There was a lot of information about git, though in the advertisement it was written that participant should already know how to use it. I was more interested in documentation, licensing and reproducibility, It could be better to split the groups by levels.

column13: Exploratory programming is much easier now that I've started using Git as a result of the workshop. I'm my project files/directories are not as cluttered with (commented) experimental code or copies of similar files.
column14: I would have been interested in further discussion on pull requests, specifically WIP pull requests.    An exercise, such as updating a [WIP]PR after getting feedback code review, would be a nice addition.

column13: My coding has not changed a lot, but I am very thankful for the broader knowledge it gave me on these issues
column14: I am not totally convinced that hands on experience is need for all the topics. The selection of topics was good, and I am sure different aspects will be addressed in later sessions.

column14: Workshop was very good. Depending on the size of your projects, some of the tools may be a bit of an overkill. I would gladly follow the workshop again to become even more comfortable with the techniques I would be a little bit reluctant to implement right now.

column14: Even though I have not been able to implement everything that was taught in the course, I do intend to start doing so sooner than later.  It is really helpful that the material is available after the course is over for me to go over it when I have the means to do so.  This course helped me alot and is extremely well taught.  Thank you!
